meanings.definition: Having the smell or taste of fish.
meanings.sent1: The fishier smell of the seafood market made her wrinkle her nose.
meanings.sent2: The fishier taste of the salmon indicated it was not fresh.
meanings.sent3: The fishier odor coming from the kitchen was a sign that something was not right.
meanings.sent4: The fishier flavor of the dish left a lingering unpleasantness in his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The fishier scent of the lake reminded him of his childhood fishing trips.

meanings.sent1: His fishier behavior made his friends wonder what he was up to.
meanings.sent2: The fishier details of the story made her doubt its truthfulness.
meanings.sent3: The fishier excuse he gave for being late raised eyebrows among his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The fishier character in the movie kept the audience guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The fishier package left on the doorstep made her call the authorities.
